channel.title: Packet when typing?
channel.description: Is there any packet called when you type something? I bet not, but i wish to do something like that, i want something to happen when i click a key without having to press enter, any ideas?

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

thanks guys

Read full topic

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

mouse recording was implemented in 377 iirc, just not use in private servers because who tf cares if someone bots on a private server

as for your ‘notification’ packets or whatever — keyboard is handled via client sided. the packet for the chat is not created/sent until the user hits [enter] and the input follows all given rules. this is how clan chat, public chat, and commands are all different opcode ids.

you can already check for keystrokes (key pressed, key down, key combinations) all previous to the actual ““input string”” as most fudge tards like to refer to it seeing as 377s generally switch tabs with the function keys.

once you check for the shit you want, create the new packet or whatever you want - if it doesnt apply to your check -> continue with the standard chat or whatever it may be.

good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:8, topic:553828”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=672749.msg4498967#msg4498967 date=1447648379]

Not sure about old clients but the new ones do have this.

@sk8rdude461
You can have a cap or a filter but really the stress is minimal especially if it’s just a notification packet.

I’ll be honest. I wasn’t thinking of it being just a notification packet.
I was thinking it’d be sending information (Such as whatever the user had typed maybe?).
[/quote]
I think there’s a packet for getting x,y position of the mouse too (bot detection?) in newer clients.
Wouldn’t be supprised if there’s a packet for getting the letter typed too. If any server stress was an issue, auto typers would not even be allowed.[/quote]
Auto typers aren’t allowed on runescape 3… It’s a form of macroing (I’ve been told this by multiple pmods).

The only auto typer allowed is the one they built into the OSRS client or whatever.
And you’re also thinking minuscule again.

I was thinking it’d send a full line of data… Ex:
Every time a player types a letter into the chatbox, the entire chatbox string is sent to the server.

And there’s also this thing where runescape is a big company that has rather powerful servers (Better than vpses you see for a rsps)… So of course they don’t need to worry as much.

Oh, and about the x and y thing. They do have it.

RuneScape Wiki

Route-finding Update

This official news post is copied verbatim from the RuneScape website. It is copyrighted by Jagex.It was added on 17 March 2009. In this week’s update, we’ve implemented an extremely frequently-requested improvement to route-finding. This should...


To quote them directly:

To fix the problem we have had to move the route-finding calculation onto our servers, so that the route is always calculated from the correct spot. However, [b]before we could do that we had to upgrade all of our servers to be able to handle the extra computations[/b] required! We’ve finally made this investment, and have been able to update the route-finding accordingly.

They had to literally upgrade all their servers just to handle sending the walking information to the server.

Read full topic

Not sure about old clients but the new ones do have this.

@sk8rdude461
You can have a cap or a filter but really the stress is minimal especially if it’s just a notification packet.
[/quote]
I’ll be honest. I wasn’t thinking of it being just a notification packet.
I was thinking it’d be sending information (Such as whatever the user had typed maybe?).[/quote]
I think there’s a packet for getting x,y position of the mouse too (bot detection?) in newer clients.
Wouldn’t be supprised if there’s a packet for getting the letter typed too. If any server stress was an issue, auto typers would not even be allowed.

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

I have no idea what your looking for could you be a bit more specific?
Anyways:

case 1: you want to use the client to send a packet to the server and cause something to happen you should open up your client and add a key listener that listens for a key combination and then checks if the client is being used on a computer with the mac address listed in a array(a pre approved list of people who can use key combinations) and then send a packet to the server which can
cause just about anything to happen but this would require messing with packets and the stream which is a bit advanced.

case 2: Your hosting the server on a local machine this would be bad in the first place but possible if this is you, you could add a key listener to the server and all that packet nonsense would go away problem is if its ever not hosted on a local machine you may have some issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Not sure about old clients but the new ones do have this.

@sk8rdude461
You can have a cap or a filter but really the stress is minimal especially if it’s just a notification packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet when typing?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Are you sure what you’re trying to do can’t be accomplished another way?

One, that doesn’t exist… And two, have you considered how much stress that can put on the server?
If this is going to be hosted, you should always try and test for scalability (player-wise).
Would your server be able to handle 100 people typing at 10,000 keystrokes per hour?

You should try to either A) Do this all client sided if no server-verification is needed. B) Send the minimal packets to the server. Make it so it’s only sent after a special key, like enter, is pressed. Or after a button (on screen) is hit, etc.

Read full topic
